messages.content: As an AI assistant, my role is to meticulously analyze criminal justice documents and extract information about law enforcement personnel. The response will contain: 1) The name of a law enforcement personnel. The individual's name must be prefixed with one of the following titles to be in law enforcement: Detective, Sergeant, Lieutenant, Captain, Deputy, Officer, Patrol Officer, Criminalist, Technician, Coroner, or Dr. Please prefix the name with 'Officer Name:  I will derive this data from the following paragraph: REPORT: 340-2563-E DATE: 12/10/23  At approximately 8:45 AM on oCtObEr 10, Patrol Officer T. U. Randall responded to an incident at 512 Oak Avenue. There were reports of a loud altercation between neighbors. Information provided by: Dr. Harrison - MEDICAL EXAMINER.  Mr. Peterson, an accountant, reported seeing Mr. Collins, a mechanic, behaving aggressively. Mrs. Collins tried to intervene. Patrol Division, ATTENTION: Officer X. Y. Zane.  Officer Randall was soon joined by Detective A. B. Clark who started questioning the witnesses. Mrs. Collins shared that there had been tensions due to a property dispute. ADD NOTES: Deputy C. D. Welch.  Detective Clark decided to consult with Lieutenant E. F. Greene about potential charges. In the meantime, Forensic Technician Gina processed the scene and found a letter that might serve as evidence.  Based on the findings, Captain G. H. Irving advised that no arrests be made at the moment but to continue monitoring the situation. Patrolman J. K. Lewis was assigned to the case for follow-up visits.  FORWARD DOCUMENTS TO: DETECTIVE BRANCH. REVIEW REQUIRED: Lieutenant Greene, Detective Clark, Patrolman Lewis, Forensic Technician Gina, Patrol Officer Randall, Captain Irving, Deputy Welch  CASE COMPONENTS:  Witness Statements Forensic Findings Letter Evidence Surveillance Footage Incident Reports (6) Medical Evaluations CONTACT INFORMATION: CHIEF OF OPERATIONS P. Q. Moore L.P.D. 345-015 F6A 7232 Peterson, ALAN ADDRESS: TELEPHONE: 328-1092 OFFICER: T. U. RANDALL ITEM: 203-7891- 340 INCIDENT: 8:45 IDENTIFICATION NUMBER 45723 - FILED Maria Perez DATE 12/11/23 DISPATCH TO: DETECTIVE DIVISION COMPLETED.
Identify each individual in the transcript, by name, who are directly referred to as officers, sergeants, lieutenants, captains, detectives, homicide officers, and crime lab personnel.

Officer Name: Patrol Officer T. U. Randall  
Officer Context: At approximately 8:45 AM on October 10, Patrol Officer T. U. Randall responded to an incident at 512 Oak Avenue.  
Officer Role: Patrol Officer 

Officer Name: Detective A. B. Clark  
Officer Context: Officer Randall was soon joined by Detective A. B. Clark who started questioning the witnesses.  
Officer Role: Detective 

Officer Name: Deputy C. D. Welch  
Officer Context: ADD NOTES: Deputy C. D. Welch.  
Officer Role: Deputy 

Officer Name: Lieutenant E. F. Greene  
Officer Context: Detective Clark decided to consult with Lieutenant E. F. Greene about potential charges.  
Officer Role: Lieutenant 

Officer Name: Forensic Technician Gina  
Officer Context: In the meantime, Forensic Technician Gina processed the scene and found a letter that might serve as evidence.  
Officer Role: Forensic Technician 

Officer Name: Captain G. H. Irving  
Officer Context: Based on the findings, Captain G. H. Irving advised that no arrests be made at the moment but to continue monitoring the situation.  
Officer Role: Captain 

Officer Name: Patrolman J. K. Lewis  
Officer Context: Patrolman J. K. Lewis was assigned to the case for follow-up visits.  
Officer Role: Patrolman
